translation.en: [in Yiddish] Esty! You can't go out!
High winds broke a wire just down the street.
translation.it: Il vento ha spezzato un cavo giù in fondo.

translation.en: -Someone will fix it. -[woman 2] Tomorrow. Not on the Sabbath!
translation.it: - Qualcuno lo aggiusterà. - Domani. Non di sabbath!

translation.en: I can't go to my mother's for lunch!
translation.it: Non potrò pranzare da mia madre.

translation.en: And I have an excuse to avoid my mother-in-law!
translation.it: E io ho una scusa per evitare mia suocera!

translation.en: You know, Esty's not trapped like we are! She doesn't have a baby to carry.
translation.it: Esty non è in trappola come noi! Non deve portarsi dietro un bebè.

translation.en: Good point! Just leave your bag upstairs.
translation.it: Giusto! Lascia la busta di sopra.

translation.en: -Where are you going? -To my parents-in-law. For lunch.
translation.it: - Dove vai? - Dai miei suoceri. A pranzo.

translation.en: She wasn't sick when I left this morning.
It's always something with Esty, isn't it?
translation.it: Esty ne ha sempre una. O no?

translation.en: Go the long way around Williamsburg, please.
[in Yiddish] Yanky, shouldn't you be at the synagogue?
translation.it: Yanky, non dovresti essere in sinagoga?

translation.en: She wasn't home after lunch yesterday
translation.it: Ieri dopo pranzo, non era a casa.

translation.en: and she never came home last night.

translation.it: - Dove può essere andata? - A saperlo!

translation.en: Has she been in an accident?

translation.it: Forse se n'è andata e basta.

translation.en: That girl was never good enough for you!
translation.it: Quella ragazza non ti ha mai meritato.

translation.en: -[man 4] Mimi! -[Mimi] She was trouble from the start.
translation.it: - Mimi! - Si vedeva che avrebbe portato solo guai.
Senza madre, il padre così strano...

translation.en: A year of marriage and not even a baby!
translation.it: Un anno di matrimonio e nemmeno un figlio!

translation.en: We shouldn't have agreed to the match.
translation.it: Non dovevamo acconsentire a questa unione.

translation.en: [Esty's grandma] My father loved this song.
He had a wonderful voice, Esty.
All the men in his family did.
translation.it: Tutti gli uomini della famiglia avevano una bella voce.

translation.en: But soon you'll have children of your own.
translation.it: Ma presto avrai dei bambini tutti tuoi.

translation.en: -Grandpa will be home any minute. -[Esty] He's not here yet!
translation.it: - Nonno arriverà a minuti. - Ma ancora non c'è.

translation.en: So he'll hear women singing when he arrives? No.
translation.it: Vuoi che senta delle donne cantare, quando arriva?

translation.en: [in Yiddish] The matchmaker made a suggestion.
translation.it: Il sensale ha fatto una proposta.

translation.en: The Shapiros near the Navy Yard.
translation.it: Gli Shapiro, vicino al Navy Yard.

translation.en: But the father has never worked.
translation.it: Ma il padre non ha mai lavorato.

translation.en: -He sits and studies! -[Esty's grandma in English] That's good!
translation.it: - Sta sempre seduto e studia. - Bene!

translation.en: -[in Yiddish] What's the boy like? -What's the boy like?
translation.it: - Il ragazzo com'è? - Il ragazzo com'è?

translation.en: Your marriage will mark the beginning of a new life!
translation.it: Il matrimonio sarà l'inizio di una nuova vita, per te.

translation.en: [Malka in English] Hold on a minute.
[in Yiddish] Let's wait till the Shapiros agree to the match, alright?
translation.it: Vediamo prima se gli Shapiro accettano.

translation.en: After all, Esty is an orphan.
You're not staying for the meal?
[in Yiddish] Tell us everything about your wife, Yanky.
translation.it: Dicci tutto della tua vita, Yanky.

translation.en: I'm in Manhattan during the day.
I work with my brothers in the business now.
translation.it: Sto al negozio coi miei fratelli.

translation.en: Esty does what all the other wives do.
translation.it: Esty fa quello che fa ogni moglie.

translation.en: She shops, she cooks, she visits her grandmother...
translation.it: Fa la spesa, cucina, fa visita alla nonna.

translation.en: Esty isn't like the other wives.
translation.it: Esty non è come le altre mogli.

translation.en: Yanky, come on! She doesn't even visit with them.
translation.it: Lo sai! Non passa mai del tempo con loro.

translation.en: You have no idea how Esty spends the day.
translation.it: Tu non sai che fa Esty di giorno.

translation.en: Gentlemen. The point is, we can't have our people losing their way.
translation.it: Signori, il punto è che non possiamo lasciare che la nostra gente si smarrisca.

translation.en: We need to find this young woman and bring her back to her husband!
translation.it: Dobbiamo trovare questa giovane e riportarla dal marito.

translation.en: -I've asked your cousin Moishe to help. -Moishe?
translation.it: - Ho chiesto al cugino Moishe di aiutarci. - Moishe?

translation.en: The rabbi understands that Moishe has his own problems, right?
translation.it: Il rabbino sa che anche Moishe ha i suoi problemi.

translation.en: Not to mention, in his marriage.
translation.it: Per non parlare del suo matrimonio.

translation.en: "A Jew, though he sinned, is still a Jew."
translation.it: "Un Ebreo, anche se ha trasgredito, è un Ebreo."

translation.en: Moishe is the one to find your son's wife.
translation.it: Sarà Moishe a ritrovare tua nuora.

translation.en: How far can she possibly have gone?
Miriam Shapiro wants to see you.
How will I know which one she is?
Now walk as if you're looking for something. With a smile.
translation.it: Cammina come se stessi cercando qualcosa. E sorridi.

translation.en: [barista] Would you like to see a menu?
You have a lot of friends.
Yeah. A lot of tired friends.
-[barista] That will be two euros, twenty. -Yes.
-[in English] Here we are. Coffee! -[man 7] Oh, nice!
-They're all the same. -[woman 7] Thanks. You're so sweet.
-[in German] We'll start in a minute. -OK, I'm coming.
[in English] We have to bring these inside,
because we have a rehearsal now.
-See you around. -[woman 8] See you around, Esty.
I'm assuming you all stayed in last night and practiced your parts?
translation.it: Immagino che sarete tutti rimasti a casa a provare, ieri sera.

translation.en: Can anyone think of a better way to spend a Saturday evening in Berlin?
translation.it: Cosa c'è di meglio da fare, il sabato sera a Berlino?

translation.en: Let's start from the trio of the second movement.
translation.it: Partiamo dal trio del secondo movimento.

translation.en: Peace be upon you! How do you do?
translation.it: La pace sia con te. Come va?

translation.en: Don't forget, Esty. He speaks first.
translation.it: Ricorda, Esty. Deve parlare prima lui.

translation.en: My father took me and my brothers to Europe last spring.
translation.it: Mio padre ha portato me e i miei fratelli in Europa, la scorsa primavera.

translation.en: We visited the graves of all the famous rabbis.
translation.it: Abbiamo visitato le tombe dei rabbini più famosi.

translation.en: You went all the way to Europe and all you saw were graves?
translation.it: Sei andato fino in Europa solo per vedere delle tombe?

translation.en: but my father didn't allow it.
translation.it: ma mio padre non era d'accordo.

translation.en: I want to go back someday.
They say London and Paris are beautiful.
translation.it: Dicono che Londra e Parigi siano bellissime.

translation.en: I've never been anywhere but New York.
translation.it: Io sono stata solo a New York.
Non c'è niente di meglio di casa tua.

translation.en: My brothers and I sometimes perform together with my father.
translation.it: A volte io e i miei fratelli suoniamo con mio padre.

translation.en: I mean, do you like music?
I bet you sound beautiful when you play together.
translation.it: Scommetto che siete bravissimi, quando suonate insieme.

translation.en: I hope to see it one day.
I'm not like the other girls.
translation.it: che non sono come le altre ragazze.

translation.en: I'm different from the other girls.
[in English] I'll get the car, guys.
It was the most beautiful thing I have ever heard.
translation.it: È la cosa più bella che abbia mai sentito.

translation.en: -[man 8] I'm ready. -Let's go! Come on. Dasia!
translation.it: - Io sono pronto. - Andiamo. Forza. Dasia!

translation.en: I have to practice. What the hell am I supposed to do?
[in Yiddish] You spoke to her mother?
You know she doesn't have a mother. Just a grandmother and an aunt.
translation.it: Lo sai che non ha la madre. Solo la nonna e la zia.

translation.en: My cousin, Moishe Lefkovitch. You remember him.
translation.it: Mio cugino, Moishe Lefkovitch. Se lo ricorda?

translation.en: We're here to ask you and your mother that question exactly.
translation.it: È quello che vorremmo chiedere a lei e a sua madre.

translation.en: Now it's my job to keep track of your wife?
translation.it: È compito mio sapere dov'è tua moglie?

translation.en: She hasn't been home since yesterday.
translation.it: È da ieri che non torna a casa.

translation.en: [Malka] Nobody can find out about this.
-Can we ask your mother a few questions? -[Malka] No!
translation.it: - Possiamo parlare con sua madre? - No!

translation.en: You want to scare an old woman?
Her life hasn't been difficult enough?
It's as she left it when she moved out to get married.
translation.it: Non l'ho toccata da quando si è sposata.

translation.en: [woman 9 in English] Yeah, I'm teaching a class!
I am Mordecai Schwartz. This is my daughter.
translation.it: Sono Mordecai Schwartz. Lei è mia figlia.
Sono qui perché è in ritardo.

translation.en: We're here to collect the rent.
I have a tour coming up in two weeks, OK? It's two weeks in the Midwest.
translation.it: Tra due settimane parto per una tournée nel Midwest.

translation.en: I'll get paid right after. And then I can pay you the back rent.
translation.it: Mi pagheranno subito e potrò saldare gli arretrati.

translation.en: And then I'll pay you three months in advance, OK?
translation.it: E le pagherò anche tre mesi in anticipo.
A mio padre servono i soldi.

translation.en: Yeah, I'm good for it. I just need two weeks.
[in English] George? I'll just be one more minute, OK?
translation.it: George, un minuto e sono da te, ok?

translation.en: -[Mordecai in Yiddish] So what? What? -[in English] Do you play?
Anyway, we don't have one at home.
translation.it: Non ne abbiamo uno a casa.

translation.en: [in Yiddish] Why did you send me? Go yourself!
translation.it: Perché hai mandato me? Vai tu!

translation.en: -[in English] You're welcome to play here. -[Mordecai in Yiddish] I don't know!
translation.it: - Puoi venire a suonare qui, se vuoi. - Non lo so!

translation.en: [in English] If you want, I could teach you.
[man 8] Is this your first time in Berlin, Esty?
translation.it: È la tua prima volta a Berlino, Esty?

translation.en: [in German] Let's show her something nice.
-[in English] Let's go! -Like what? Hitler's bunker?
translation.it: - Sì! - Dove? Al bunker di Hitler?

translation.en: -It's still there? -No, she's just messing with you.
translation.it: - C'è ancora? - No. Ti sta prendendo in giro.

translation.en: Or we can take selfies at the memorial to the murdered Jews of Europe.
translation.it: Andiamo a fare i selfie al monumento alle vittime ebree in Europa.

translation.en: That, Yael, is a superb idea.
And the memorial to the murdered homosexuals is just across the street.
translation.it: E di fronte c'è il monumento alle vittime omosessuali.

translation.en: there's one to the murdered Sinti and Romas nearby, too.
translation.it: c'è anche quello ai sinti e ai rom.

translation.en: -[woman 7] You don't sound like it. -I've never been anywhere else.
translation.it: - Non si direbbe. - Non sono mai uscita da lì.

translation.en: Yemen. But I grew up near Munich.
translation.it: Yemen. Ma sono cresciuta vicino a Monaco.

translation.en: And I'm from Israel, Ahmed is from Nigeria,
translation.it: Io sono israeliana, Ahmed è nigeriano.

translation.en: Clemens... is German, but your parents came from...?
translation.it: Clemens è tedesco. Ma i tuoi sono...

translation.en: And Robert is the only one of us who is actually from Berlin.
translation.it: E Robert è l'unico tra noi originario di Berlino.

translation.en: So he can answer all your burning questions about the war.
translation.it: Risponderà lui alle tue domande scottanti sulla guerra.

translation.en: My grandparents lost their whole families in the camps.
translation.it: I miei nonni hanno perso la famiglia nei campi.

translation.en: But we're too busy defending our present to be sentimental about our past.
translation.it: Ma col presente da difendere, non possiamo abbandonarci al passato.

translation.en: -Yael always talks big, big, big-- -A lot of talking.
translation.it: - Che Yael parla, parla... - Un sacco!

translation.en: [Robert] Yeah, a lot of talking. But she's never been in military combat.
translation.it: Ma lei non ha mai dovuto combattere.

translation.en: She was playing the violin in the military orchestra.
Like Vivaldi's "Four Seasons" every weekend, madam?
translation.it: Tipo "Le quattro stagioni" di Vivaldi ogni weekend?
A volte facevamo "La nona di Beethoven"!

translation.en: Well, at least you have a life. [giggles]
translation.it: Beh, almeno tu hai una vita.

translation.en: The conference where the Nazis decided to kill the Jews in the concentration camps
translation.it: La conferenza in cui i nazisti decisero di mandare gli ebrei nei campi

translation.en: And you swim in this lake?
translation.it: E voi nuotate in questo lago?

translation.en: Well, the lake is just a lake.
translation.it: Beh, il lago è solo un lago.

translation.en: When the Berlin Wall was up,
translation.it: Ai tempi del Muro di Berlino,

translation.en: East German guards shot anyone who tried to swim across this lake to freedom.
translation.it: le guardie della DDR sparavano a chi cercava di fuggire a nuoto da qui.

translation.en: Now you can swim as far as you like.
translation.it: Adesso puoi nuotare quanto ti pare.

translation.en: You go in. I'll watch everyone's stuff.
translation.it: Vai pure. Guardo io la roba.

translation.en: You can't just come into my apartment like this!
translation.it: Non potete entrare a casa mia così!

translation.en: I've been paying my rent on time!
You know exactly who I'm talking about.
-Moishe! -Jesus! What is wrong with you people?
translation.it: - Moishe! - Cristo! Ma che problema avete?

translation.en: She quit the piano lessons for you.
translation.it: Ha smesso di fare lezione per te.

translation.en: Tell me where to find her.
-I don't know. -[Moishe] Alright, Ms. Vivian Dropkin.
translation.it: - Non lo so. - Ok, signora Vivian Dropkin.

translation.en: If you don't tell us where she is, we'll cut off your electricity.
translation.it: Ci dica dov'è o le stacchiamo la corrente.

translation.en: [in Yiddish] Maybe she doesn't know anything.
translation.it: Può darsi che non sappia niente.

translation.en: [in English] We'll cut off your internet.
And then we'll cancel your lease.
translation.it: E poi le daremo lo sfratto.

translation.en: -[Dasia] Ahmed doesn't know any German. -[Esty] Really?
Yeah, but he thinks he can fake speaking German with just three words.
translation.it: Sì, ma pensa di poter fregare tutti con solo tre parole.

translation.en: We have the same words in Yiddish:
translation.it: Abbiamo le stesse parole in Yiddish.

translation.en: I will try that, if I ever go to a dinner party.
translation.it: Ci proverò, se mai dovessi andare a una festa.

translation.en: So you're really going back to practice now? What, so late?
translation.it: Davvero adesso torni ad esercitarti? A quest'ora?

translation.en: The academy is open till midnight.
-I hope to see you around, Esty. -Yeah.
Yanky, one thing leads to another. You let her take piano lessons with that shiksa, right?
translation.it: Yanky, una cosa tira l'altra. Le hai fatto studiare piano dalla non-ebrea.

translation.en: [in Yiddish] There are greater sins! Schlomo Moskowitz takes his wife out to bars in Manhattan!
translation.it: C'è di peggio! Schlomo Moskowitz porta la moglie nei bar di Manhattan!

translation.en: I mean, even your clothes? Your phone?
Esty took nothing because it was the Sabbath and the eruv was broken.
translation.it: Esty non ha preso niente perché era sabbath e si era rotto l'eruv.

translation.en: Did you already check her phone for funny numbers?
translation.it: Hai visto se ha numeri strani in rubrica?

translation.en: The doctor's office called about blood test results
translation.it: La clinica ha i risultati delle analisi.

translation.en: and offered an appointment for an ultrasound next week.
translation.it: Dovrà fare un'ecografia tra una settimana.

translation.en: -[guard in German] Good evening! -[Dasia] Good evening!
And she didn't even take anything with her!
translation.it: E non si è portata niente!

translation.en: -That depends how you look at it. -She took the baby!
translation.it: - Dipende da come la guardi. - Si è portata il bambino.

translation.en: Her crazy mother lives in Berlin!
I thought she came from England?
She came from Manchester to Williamsburg,
but when she left Yanky's father-in-law, she moved to Germany.
translation.it: ma quando lasciò il suocero di Yanky, andò in Germania.

translation.en: We shouldn't have agreed to this marriage.
The apple doesn't fall far from the tree.
translation.it: - La mela cade sempre vicino all'albero. - Mimi!

translation.en: The rabbi wants me to go to Berlin?
translation.it: Il rabbino vuole che vada a Berlino?

translation.en: [rabbi] Life is a never-ending battle between good and evil.
translation.it: La vita è una lotta continua tra bene e male.
Dio ci mette sempre alla prova.

translation.en: Anyway, the boy can't handle a trip to Berlin on his own.
translation.it: Comunque il ragazzo non può affrontare un viaggio a Berlino da solo.

translation.en: The rabbi wants me to go to Berlin with Yanky?
translation.it: Il rabbino vuole che vada a Berlino con Yanky?

translation.en: Of course he's going with you, Moishe!
translation.it: Certo che verrà con te, Moishe!
Quello è il figlio di Yanky!
Ho saputo che stai per sposarti.

translation.en: I will wait in the kitchen.
[in English] You stopped being my mother the day you left Williamsburg.
translation.it: Non lo sei più da quando hai lasciato Williamsburg.

translation.en: [in Yiddish] No. I will always be your mother.
[in English] No matter where I go.
I wanted to give you this.
Proves your right to German citizenship.
Because my parents, your grandparents, were born there.
translation.it: I miei genitori, i tuoi nonni, erano nati là.

translation.en: It's just in case you need somewhere else to go.
translation.it: In caso te ne volessi andare da qui.

translation.en: I'm getting married. Don't you get it?
I'm going to make a family with Yanky Shapiro.
translation.it: Metterò su famiglia con Yanky Shapiro.

translation.en: Lots of children. A real home.
I won't ever need anywhere else to go. This is what I want.
translation.it: Non andrò da nessuna parte. È questo che voglio.

translation.en: OK. -OK, you think that now-- -Don't you tell me what I think.
translation.it: - Ok. Ma adesso la pensi così... - Non dirmi cosa penso.

translation.en: -You don't even know me. -[Esty's mom] Maybe not.
But you keep those documents safe, please.
translation.it: Ma tu conserva lo stesso quei documenti.

translation.en: Rabbi, I don't know if I'm the right--
translation.it: Rabbino, io non so se sono...

translation.en: Bring back Esther Shapiro and God will take care of you.
translation.it: Riporta indietro Esther Shapiro e Dio ti ricompenserà.

translation.en: Work things out with your wife and children.
The rabbi will do all that for me?
